name: RocketPods: Cyber Octane
description:
Backstory

The Unity Game engine is a fantastic tool but it's not my favorite. It can sometimes feel clunky and bloated to make a games with. But am I wrong? There's only one way to find out! I was challenge by YOU to make a 3D game using Unity and here's how it turned out. Will my thoughts change on the engine? Is Unity's Particle System too strong for Godot? Or will Unity break me one and for all...

Gameplay

The game is very simple. Complete one a lap around the space station as fast as you possibly can. Make sure to submit your fastest scores in the comments down below.

Controls
  • Thrust/Reverse - Up/Down Arrow Keys
  • Steer -  Left/Right Arrow Keys
  • Space/Enter - Select
  • ESC - Exit/Return to Menu
Disclaimer

This is less of a game and more of a prototype of what a RocketPods racing game could look like. If you actually want to play a real game that's much more polished, make sure to check out the real Rocketpods game here.
